intro: Xyloselinum vietnamense, commonly known as Vietnamese xyloselinum, is a flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
